content.value_statement: Repeated AI interactions waste time and produce inconsistent results. This skill teaches you to extract patterns from successful prompts and encode them as reusable templates that save time, reduce errors, and capture domain expertise.

use_cases.title: Create Code Review Templates
use_cases.description: Build parameterized code review prompts that capture team standards, language preferences, and severity levels.

use_cases.title: Standardize Documentation Prompts
use_cases.description: Design templates for API docs, README generation, and code comments that enforce consistent formatting.

use_cases.title: Build Incident Response Templates
use_cases.description: Create parameterized templates for debugging scripts, log analysis, and deployment post-mortems.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Pattern Detection
prompt_templates.scenario: Identify if a prompt is template-worthy
prompt_templates.prompt: Have I used a similar prompt 2+ times? Does this prompt have 5+ decision points? What stays constant and what changes between uses?

prompt_templates.title: Parameter Extraction
prompt_templates.prompt: For my prompt about [TASK_TYPE], identify: (1) What varies between instances, (2) What constraints stay the same, (3) Parameters with 3-7 options max.

prompt_templates.title: Template Structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a prompt template using this structure: INTENT: [action verb + description], CONSTRAINTS: [list of invariants], SUCCESS CRITERIA: [measurable outcomes]. Include example filled template.

prompt_templates.title: Template Evaluation
prompt_templates.prompt: Evaluate my template: What is the success rate target? Time saved? Iterations needed? Team adoption rate? Identify anti-patterns like over-parameterization or premature templating.

output_examples.input: I keep asking Claude to generate Git commit messages for my team. What should I do?
output: Use the prompt 2+ times to confirm the pattern works
Identify what stays constant: commit format, conventional rules
Identify what changes: ticket number, scope, changes made

output_examples.input: Our team needs consistent code reviews but everyone does them differently.
output: Extract the common review criteria your team agrees on
Create parameters for language, focus areas, and severity
Define invariants: must-pass checks, style requirements
Include concrete examples showing filled templates
Measure adoption and success rate over time

output_examples.input: How do I know if a prompt should become a template?
output: Ask: Have I used this pattern 2+ times successfully?
Check: Does it have 5+ decision points?
Verify: Does it encode domain knowledge?
If yes to all, extract the pattern into a template

best_practices: Wait for second use before templating to avoid premature abstraction
Limit parameters to 3-7 per template to maintain usability
Include concrete filled examples and common mistakes for each template
anti_patterns: Template before pattern emerges (premature templating adds maintenance burden)
Over-parameterization with 15+ parameters (split into focused templates instead)
Under-parameterization where template only works for one specific scenario

faq.question: Which AI tools work with this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. The methodology applies to any AI assistant that accepts text prompts.

faq.question: How many parameters should a template have?
faq.answer: Aim for 3-7 parameters. More indicates the template is too complex and should be split into focused templates.

faq.question: When should I create a template?
faq.answer: Wait until you have used a similar prompt 2+ times with success. Premature templating adds unnecessary maintenance burden.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only provides methodology guidance. It does not access, store, or transmit any data externally.

faq.question: What if my template is not working well?
faq.answer: Track metrics like success rate and time saved. If template adds more cognitive load than it saves, discontinue use and refine parameters.

faq.question: How is this different from simple prompt libraries?
faq.answer: This skill teaches the skill of extracting patterns and designing templates, not just collecting prompts. Focuses on the why behind each template element.
